meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strange or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The wonkiness of the old clock made it hard to tell the time.
meanings.sent2: Her outfit had a certain wonkiness that made it stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The wonkiness of the clown's shoes added to his comedic act.
meanings.sent4: The wonkiness of the mirror distorted her reflection like a funhouse.
meanings.sent5: The wonkiness of the tree's branches created interesting shadows on the ground.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being unsteady or off-balance.
meanings.sent1: The wonkiness of the wobbly table made it difficult to eat without spilling.
meanings.sent2: After the roller coaster ride, she felt wonkiness in her legs as she walked.
meanings.sent3: The wonkiness of the boat on the choppy waters made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His wonkiness on the ice skates reminded him of a newborn deer learning to walk.
meanings.sent5: The wonkiness of the tightrope walker added an element of danger to the performance.
